boat.construction_details: Carvel Larch on sawn oak frames
boat.full_description:
Amanda is thought to have been built for Annan owners in 1920, and may originally have been called Olive. Annan is on the Solway Firth in Scotland and was an important fishing port with 70 boats in 1900.

Youngs make potted shrimps in the town. Shrimp trawling was started in Annan in the 1850s by fishermen from Morecambe (or Poulton-le-Sands as it was known then known).

Crossfields made a number of boats for the Annan trade.

Since 1979 Amanda has been kept on the Wirral at West Kirby and used for cruising. West Kirby is on the River Dee side of he Wirral and has become one of the main sailing centres in the area. She was purchased in 2018 by a new owner who planned to bring her to Arnside in 2020 on her way to Annan to celebrate her centenary.
boat.name: Amanda
boat.short_description: Amanda was built in 1920 by Crossfields of Arnside.
